Class CaveNode

java.lang.Object
CaveNode
public class CaveNode
extends java.lang.Object
CaveNode class is the building block of the cave adventure. Each room will consist of a CaveNode that contains the pertinent information about the room's contents and description.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    CaveNode​(int level, java.lang.String adj1, java.lang.String adj2)
    Builds a CaveNode and populates it the appropriate monsters and items, at the appropriate level.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean beenSearched()
    Accessor to check if this cavern has been searched.
    Item getLoot()
    Returns the current loot type, if there is loot.
    Monster getMonster()
    Gives the caller a pointer to the Monster object in this cave.
    boolean hasLoot()
    Accessor to check if this cavern has loots.
    boolean hasMonster()
    Accessor to check if this cavern has a monster.
    void killMonster()
    Eliminates the monster from this cavern when the monster is killed.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • CaveNode

      public CaveNode​(int level, java.lang.String adj1, java.lang.String adj2)
      Builds a CaveNode and populates it the appropriate monsters and items, at the appropriate level.
      Parameters:
      level - The player's level at the time of entering the cavern.
      adj1 - The first word describing this particular cavern.
      adj2 - The second word describing this particular cavern.
      Since:
      1.0

  • Method Details

    • hasLoot

      public boolean hasLoot()
      Accessor to check if this cavern has loots.
      Returns:
      If the cavern has loot or not.
      Since:
      1.1

    • beenSearched

      public boolean beenSearched()
      Accessor to check if this cavern has been searched.
      Returns:
      If this cavern has been searched yet.
      Since:
      1.1

    • hasMonster

      public boolean hasMonster()
      Accessor to check if this cavern has a monster.
      Returns:
      If there is a monster here.
      Since:
      1.1

    • getMonster

      public Monster getMonster() throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Gives the caller a pointer to the Monster object in this cave.
      Returns:
      The monster in this cave.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no monster in this cave.
      Since:
      1.1

    • killMonster

      public void killMonster() throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Eliminates the monster from this cavern when the monster is killed.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no monster in here.
      Since:
      1.1

    • getLoot

      public Item getLoot() throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Returns the current loot type, if there is loot.
      Returns:
      The loot item in this cavern.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no loot in this cavern.
      Since:
      1.3
